items.title: North-America based Pre-sales and training Engineer at Platform.sh
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

You are a software developer that likes human contact. You are impassioned about DevOps and have experience with web technologies. You can develop in a couple of languages, but have played with a bunch of technologies; You like traveling around the country. 

Platform.sh is a cloud application platform shrouded in black magic; Multi-Cloud, Multi-Stack, Container powered. Fully buzzword compliant. Your main job would be to show-off the awesomeness.

Mission :

We are looking for a Partner Account Manager to enhance our partnership recruitment, onboarding and training activity in North America. Expect Travel. You need to live in North America (USA or Canada). This role encompasses various activities :

1. Training :

  • travel to partner locations on predetermined dates to deliver training to our North-America based partners
  • maintain training database and course data
  • gather and organize information about the product and its releases
  • monitor and evaluate the quality of training ; revise as needed
  • maintain a current understanding of training trends and best practices
  • prepare and present workshops at users’ conference if needed

This will involve delivering material through various media including user guides, videos, virtual classroom, face-to-face training.

You will end up working with our teams to design training programs and materials.

2. Sales :

  • you will learn how to identify and contact potential partners
  • organize partner meetings to discuss business opportunities
  • you don't have to have sales experience ... but that would be a plus.

3. Marketing :

  • participate in conferences and company events to promote our product and provide product demos

The ideal candidate must have :

  • the professionalism, charisma, enthusiasm, and knowledge to help convert partners into enthusiasts
  • Experience in Python and PHP development
  • Git knowledge
  • excellent communication skills
  • a customer-oriented attitude combined with a positive and proactive nature
  • autonomy and the ability to work well with a distant international team
  • willingness and excitement to travel 50% of your time in Canada and the USA ; you have easy access to an international airport
  • educational background in software development will be a plus
  • Magento, Wordpress, Symfony, Drupal and/or PaaS knowledge will grant you points

About Platform.sh

Platform.sh is a groundbreaking cloud hosting and development tool for web applications. We are a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program). Though young, we have become a major player in ecommerce and we recently helped launch Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and the Sensio Cloud on Platform.sh technology.

We are an award-winning team of hard-core hackers who want to revolutionize the way that developers and agencies build and deploy web applications. We’re mostly distributed, but we meet up daily in cyberspace, and occasionally in the real world. We value enthusiasm, team spirit, and a constant desire to expand personal knowledge and contribute to the community. We provide a multi-cultural, casual and balanced work environment.

If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you.

Benefits

Work from home, wherever you are
Safe and friendly working environment
Stock options for everyone
Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.content:
Junior Sales/Business Development

Location: London, EC2A
Start Date: ASAP
Full-time job,
9-month contract, with the aim to become permanent
Salary: £22,000 to £27,000 depending on experience
We will be interviewing on a first comes first served basis, and we will hire the right candidate ASAP.

Summary

We are looking for a hungry, motivated and high-achieving junior sales rep based in London to work on expansion of the company in the UK.

The ideal candidate needs to be a self-started with a results-oriented approach. You enjoy being out in the field, driving sales, spending time with the co-founders and understanding the need of the business. The role is a 9 months contract covering a maternity leave, with the view of becoming a full-time placement. It will involve telesales, and face-to-face (field) sales

The company
LivingPackets is a young and dynamic start-up based in Central London. Livingpackets offers a service for professionals and individuals who need speed and security for any type of parcels from samples, prototypes, documents to valuable objects - all fully insured. LivingPackets has launched the London/Paris route, and will be rolled out to other French/British cities and European capitals in 2018.
The result of two years of R&D has enabled LivingPackets to invent a bag filled with technology, amd fully patented. The smart packaging is optimised, and designed to be tracked in real-time to ensure secure shipments at all stages of the journey.
As well as saving the cost and physical waste of extraneous packaging - the bag, called the LivingPacket is designed to be reusable at least 500 times.
In a new business model that LivingPackets has renamed as CrowdSharing -the profits are distributed between the travellers, known as Voyagers who earn more than half the price of delivery; and the Guardians (contracted local shops) who receive and hold the parcels, and investors known as Sharing Angels (sponsors of the model).
A series of exclusive, limited offers enable Sharing Angels to choose the sponsorship package that works for them.


Core requirements
Highly capable, self-motivated, collaborative and personable
Strong academic record
Strong commercial skills gained from a professional background
Able to demonstrate integrity, drive and natural curiosity
An excellent written and verbal communicator, English at mother tongue level
High level of business acumen
Ability to effectively work remotely, from a co-working space and with an international team

Role and responsibilities
The Role is varied and involves a combination of strategic thinking, analysis and engagement with internal and external stakeholders.
You will be developing and maintaining value-based relationships with our customers.
You will be first working directly with the CEO UK on developing and evaluating new opportunities and continue the work during her maternity leave and until her return to work.
You will be at the heart of a truly unique movement that will have a massive impact within the UK/EU parcel delivery space.
In the first few months, you should expect to be more of a sales operations role. Here are a few examples of what you will be doing, in Sales and Operations:


The Sales Part:
- Researching organisations online to identify new lead, potential new markets, decision makers
- Contacting new potential clients via email or phone to establish a relationship and set-up meetings
- Attending conference, meeting and industry events
- Preparing presentations and proposals
- Updating clients on new developments
- Working with external design and marketers to prepare sales collateral
- Securing new clients
- Elaborate marketing and social media campaign with internal and external stakeholders to boost inbound leads

The Operations Part:
- Answer basic enquiries from Voyagers and Investors on email and by phone
- Liaise with partner stores to ensure that everything runs smoothly
- Help in elaborating partner pack and processes
- Be ready to jump on the Eurostar to Paris for a last-minute trip (so cool, right?!)
- Organise courier for deliveries when required
- Help in elaborating Courier network and processes
- Help bring new local store partner on board

Benefits
Successful candidates will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile and international team, passionate about innovation and making a difference.
We will offer guidance, mentorship and opportunities for professional development.
Equity share for the right candidate and huge professional development
Very friendly young & dynamic co-working space, in the heart of the Silicon roundabout
Dog friendly office
Coffee and tea on tap
Free breakfast every Tuesday morning

Hi there! We're looking for someone who's eager to help our newest and fastest-growing partners, like Zoom, Calendly, and Airtable, succeed in launching and growing their Zapier integration. If you're excited about SaaS, APIs, and automation, then read on.

Even though our job description may seem like we're looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you’re organized, detail oriented, excel at following up with of others, and you are intrigued by new products and technology.

About You

Meaningful relationships maximize your success. You prioritize creating, nurturing, and managing personal relationships over-relying on hastily-made contacts.

Long-term customer success tops short-term revenue. You pull in partners to activities that yield sustainable gains, not just one-time growth bumps.

Sales skills aren’t just for sales professionals. You don't hesitate to make a cold call, deliver a presentation, or negotiate a win-win deal.

You strive to build partnerships that benefit customers and partners alike. You think about how a potential partnership will solve customers' problems with practical use cases.

API documentation is familiar territory. You're comfortable looking for and suggesting improvements to an integration based on reading through a tool's API docs.

Strong writing is a skill you sharpen non-stop. From authoring a short, convincing email to an 800-word persuasive blog post, you don't stop honing your craft.

Action beats inactivity. When you're given a task, you take ownership and find an effective way to complete it, whether or not it requires dozens of Google searches.

Learning gives you satisfaction. You strive to improve your work and expand your industry and marketing knowledge.


Things You Might Do
Zapier is a small, fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:

Director of Business Development

Lean Startup Co.
Headquarters: Walnut, CA
https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/2ca49bcd5bcc01-director-of-business-development?source=weworkremotely

Born from the global movement spawned by Eric Ries’ books, Lean Startup Company offers the most exciting education solutions in modern management available today.

A cutting-edge methodology, Lean Startup principles provide a scientific approach to problem-solving and a framework for innovation, so you can learn what your customers really want. It’s about testing continuously, so you can effectively adapt and adjust before it’s too late.

LSCo’s year-round education efforts bring the entrepreneurial spirit to all types of organizations and help them transform how they work. We serve every size company and sector of the economy - from the the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions. The industry looks to us for practical knowledge and valuable lessons in modern management. Through our various media and live event efforts, we aim to serve our highly-engaged community members with professional, high-quality, and practical content.

As the Lean Startup movement grows, there is an increasing need to connect those who want to learn with those who want to help them move towards working the Startup Way. And Lean Startup Co. is the answer.

ABOUT THE POSITION

As the home base for the Lean Startup movement, we have a hearty community of enthusiastic followers. So we don’t need a Director of Business Development who preaches best practices. We are seeking a tenacious and metrics-driven Director of Business Development who has a proven track record of mastering product knowledge, building meaningful client relationships, closing large deals with enterprise companies and championing new ways of supporting our customers.
Role Overview: Learn and document the goals and challenges of large organizations seeking Lean Startup Education, determine if they’re the right fit for us to support, gain clarity on the outcome(s) they are looking for, only commit to what our Faculty can surely deliver, negotiate and close sales.

Come join us if you’re ready to help us help our customers solve the world’s biggest problems.
You’ll thrive in this role if you have experience delivering results in these four areas of core competency:

  1. You have a natural sales ability and the experience to back it up. You’ve helped develop and lead company Business Development/Sales strategy to drive sales and revenue growth.
  2. You’ve been the top Business Development/Sales performer at 1+ companies and have a track record of successful outcomes using data-driven decision-making.
  3. You’re excited to share examples of 1) your ability to pitch ideas and create tests, with the outcome to drive sales and revenue growth, 2) different strategies (e.g. new pricing) you’ve tested, and 3) impact you’ve had
  • Not only are you a sales extraordinaire, but you are also financially savvy.
    • Sure, there are plenty of folks that can show how they produce results from their efforts, but you also demonstrate a deep understanding of the business and delicate balance between business development spend, testing, and results.
    • You have a track record of developing, setting and managing ambitious and actionable sales goals, forecasts, and operating budgets that are aligned to target metrics.
    • You believe in and practice financial stewardship.
  • You are already an all-star Director of Business Development. Don’t bother talking table stakes. All you need to ramp up is time to fully master all the products we have to offer.
    • You are an excellent listener. You create meaningful relationships with customers and believe in matching their needs with the services that will solve their unique problems.
    • You’re excited to sell product offerings in the consulting services space. You’re comfortable pitching new (or refined) product offerings to existing and new markets and verticals
    • You’re a master at presenting and getting buy-in from senior leader and executive level stakeholders and know what it takes to drive closing a deal from initial qualification, formal evaluation, and negotiation all the way through to close, including pricing, legal and procurement approval
    • You’re proud to represent, and intimately know, all facets of the products you’ve sold. You can clearly communicate the value of the last few products you sold (and how it is a validated solution for your customer’s problems!).
  • You’re in it not to just hit sales goals, but to help us achieve company goals and make a bigger impact in our community.
    • You’re a team player at heart. You have sales goals to hit, and you know how to work with other functions (e.g. marketing, account management, etc) to make them happen.
    • You can proudly share stories about how your actions and efforts supported company goals/growth.

    In this role, you’ll work closely with the Director of Sales to achieve the following:

    • Test, report on, learn and iterate from the outcomes of sales initiatives
    • You’ll be deeply involved with:
    • Business development and sales planning and reporting (including setting annual revenue targets)
    • Pipeline management and expansion opportunities
    You’ll also work closely with the Director of Marketing to help inform and refine LS education products based on insider knowledge obtained from building meaningful client relationships.

    You’ll fit right into this role and our team if:

    • You are a great listener and have the ability to understand customer goals and pain points, and how our products can help solve some of their biggest challenges.
    • You’re curious and resourceful. You LOVE solving problems and aren’t afraid to admit you are obsessed with getting the details right.
    • You have experience with, and ENJOY working for a young growing startup. You’ll love the balance you need in this role; a mix of big picture, strategic thinking and rolling up your sleeves and getting into the details.
    • You love that some processes haven’t been put in place. You’re excited to be deeply involved with building out the business development and sales function and the systems and processes to steer a well-run ship and team.
    • You have a strong sense of ownership and urgency as it relates to the health of the company.
    • You possess high levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
    • You are open to feedback, take ownership of your mistakes, and love applying your lessons learned to get 10x better.
    • You have a keen ability to manage competing and changing priorities.
    • You are assertive, fair, and capable of directing others and implementing projects with little to no supervision.
    • You work well with cross-functional teams and hold yourself accountable for your actions.

    Requirements:

    • BA/BS in Marketing, Business, Communication or related field preferred. MBA or other related graduate degree a plus.
    • 7+ years of Sales experience
    • Familiarity with and enjoy working remotely and collaboratively (Slack, Zoom, Google apps).
    • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.
    • Consistent and thorough attention to detail; it's important to understand the goals and challenges of customers, craft a proposal that matches the outcomes they are looking for with our offerings, negotiate a contract that encompasses the above, and ensure our Team and Faculty can deliver on those commitments.
    • Ability to juggle and prioritize many different tasks simultaneously, and enjoy collaborating with a wide range of people.
    • Experience with Salesforce
    • Experience speaking to and negotiating with C-Suite and Senior Executives at medium to enterprise-level companies
    • Availability during regular business hours to schedule calls with prospects in varying time zones.
    • Incorporate the mission of Lean Startup Company into all aspects of the role, like encouraging customers to share their Lean Startup learnings and story with our community via blog, podcast or case study.

    Bonus if you have:

    • Experience selling consulting services
    • Business development experience in Lean Startup, tech and/or enterprise innovation spaces.
    Why You’ll Love Working With Us

    • We encourage growth.
    • If it’s your dream to become a leader in an organization, this is the role for you. We seek people who want to be promoted and grow with us.
  • You can work from wherever you want, as long as you have a working laptop and solid internet connection.
    • We’re a 100% remote team using fun, collaborative tools.
    • We encourage unplugging for vacation and prefer you don’t check email while you’re away.
  • Big impact.
    • If you’ve ever wanted to be in the middle of it all and leave a legacy, this is it. The work we do will go down in history as powerfully-transformative.
    • We are a startup with global brand recognition headquartered in San Francisco, CA. Our global community will give you a front row seat to the challenges they’re facing around innovation. Better yet, you get to help them solve their problems.

    The position is a 100% remote, full-time role, but we ask that you’re 1) located in the U.S. and 2) available to communicate during Pacific Time business hours.

    *Note - We understand that you are eager to hear back from us. We receive a lot of applications and cannot respond to all of them. Please do not reach out to us regarding your application. If there is a mutual fit, we will contact you to move forward with the next steps in the process.

It’s been successful for us so far, a rewarding and somewhat unusual working experience for self-motivated individuals (we suggest you check out our GlassDoor reviews). This is the ideal environment for creative, independent people who are open to developing through challenging work.

Our Sales team is...

High-reaching.
Brilliant at conversion.
Formed of talented individuals each with their own creative way of building effective relationships.

Could you see yourself in this team?

A significant amount of GrantTree's success is a direct result from collaboration with our partners. We work with fantastic organisations and it's important to us to continue to strengthen our relationships with each of our existing and newly on-boarded partners.

You will work closely with the Partnership Director as a member of the wider Sales team to implement new partnership plans and to grow the deal flow from our existing Partnership base. Drawing on your prior Business Development experience you'll capitalise on your expert relationship building techniques to thrive within the Partnership space.

- You have professional experience in independent lead generation (within software/tech would be a plus).
- You're confident negotiating contracts and closing new business where necessary.
- You know how to generate and manage pipelines.
- You have the ability to implement partnership delivery plans.
- You enjoy working towards targets.
- Running workshops, roundtables, existing delivery plans and attending events are key activities for you.

You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are accepted from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.
